FAQ / Keywords /

Deck

  1. In regards to reprints of wave 1 cards in wave 2, are they considered separate cards? Can I put up to 3 copies from each card in a deck?
    You can only play three cards with the same name in your battle deck, so the Wave 1 and 2 cards are interchangeable in that respect.
  2. Are the current face-down side of a character card considered Hidden Information?
    No. You may see the face-down sides of your opponent’s character cards at any time, but please ask respectfully.
  3. I have a question about the game, and apologize if you answered it somewhere in the rules, but I could not find it. It is listed that a minimum of 40 battle cards be used. And one place mentions 40+ cards. But what is the maximum number of battle cards one can have in their deck?
    There is currently no maximum number of cards allowed in your Battle Deck.
  4. I have run into a situation where my deck had no cards and no discard pile to shuffle in. We ruled it as when I attacked or defended, I had no cards to flip so I added 0 to my attack and defense. We were wondering if this would be a proper ruling.
    If your deck and scrap pile are empty, you don't flip any cards and the game proceeds.
  5. Can I have more than one of the same character on my team?
    You can’t have more than one of the same character card on your team, but you can have more than one of the same character if they’re on different cards. For example, your team can’t have two copies Bumblebee, Brave Warrior, but it could have one Bumblebee, Brave Warrior and one Bumblebee, Courageous Scout.
  6. Can my team have both Autobots and Decepticons?
    Yes. All characters in the game can work together under your leadership.
  7. I have a question about shuffle timing. What is the exact trigger that causes a player to shuffle their scrap pile into their (empty) deck? Does a shuffle occur anytime deck size = 0, or only when an effect (say, your draw step) causes you to draw a card, but you cannot do so without shuffling? If I draw the last card in my deck on my draw step, will my stay empty until I play a battle card that instructs me to draw (or declare an attacker and flip cards in combat)?
    You shuffle as soon as your deck is empty.
  8. Can you play action cards in your opponents turn when you’re responding to their attack and secondly can you have as many battle cards in your deck as you want, as long as it’s a minimum of 40?
    No, you may only play Actions if you have an Action play which is generally during your turn before you attack. You can have as many battle cards as you want over 40 as long as you can reasonably manage them.
  9. Do you reshuffle when you need to draw a card or immediately after you draw/flip/scrap your last card from your deck?
    Immediately when there are no cards in your deck.
  10. What is the 'Battlefield'?
    The game area in which the characters in play are placed.
  11. What is the 'Deck'?
    Your battle cards are shuffled and placed face down. You draw cards from your deck. As soon as the deck runs out of cards you reshuffle the scrap and that becomes your new deck.
  12. What is a 'Battle Card'?
    Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Battle Cards are the cards that are placed in the face-down stack. To date they will say either Action or Upgrade on them on the middle left of the deck, and they are all the same size. They all have the same grey/white/red background image.
  13. What is a 'Character Card'?
    Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Character Cards represent particular Transformers and are placed on the table. They have a star cost (in the bottom left hand corner of one side of the card). In the middle of the card a 'mode' will be indicated.
  14. What is a 'Stratagem Card'?
    Your deck has two types of card in it, cards which are placed on the table at the start of the game and cards that are placed in a face-down stack. The Stratagem Cards represent a background theme and are placed on the table. They have a star cost (in the bottom left hand corner of one side of the card). In the middle of the card they state that they are a 'STRATAGEM'.
  15. What is the 'Scrap'?
    Battle cards you have used, either by playing or flipping, are discarded at the end of your turn. The discard pile is called the scrap.
  16. What is a 'Trait'?
    Traits appear on Character Cards as icons under the character names. For example, Ranged, Car, and Titan Master.
